result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyrsin L Blau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 75 days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Dept. To be paid joint and several with Jackson Freckmann. All court costs to be paid as a condition of probation. Cash bail refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Attend a Mimimum of 2 Self Help meeting per week.

Submit to a psychological assessment and follow through with any treatment or counseling. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination after treatment is well established. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Commencing Forthwith. Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. 
After defendant has served 75 days and upon written request by the defendant, the Court would consider staying a portion of the Huber for compliance with Day Report Center.
8/31/2015:  COURT STAYS THE REMAINDER OF THE CONDITION TIME FOR 100 DAYS OF THE DAY REPORT CENTER.

**10/07/2015:  COURT REVOKES THE DAY REPORT CENTER.  DEFENDANT TO COMMENCE SERVING HER JAIL TERM FORTHWITH.  FIRST 10 DAYS TO BE SERVED IN MAIN JAIL WITHOUT HUBER.  REMAINER OF THE SENTENCE MAY BE SERVED AT HUBER.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kyrsin L Blau in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Case 14CT1628 dismissed and read in to this matter.

Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 5 years (Initial Confinement: 3 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years) STAYED.  Credit for 75 days if revoked.
- 3 years Probation. 
- Cash bail to be refunded to poster
- Buy money of $400.00 to be paid (jointly and severally liable with Jackson Freckmann) as a Condition of Probation
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Submit to a psychological assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school after treatment is well established.
CONDITION TIME: 6 months - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence forthwith.  After defendant has served 75 days, and upon written request by the defendant, the Court would consider staying a portion of the condition time for compliance with Day Report Center.
